metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7317 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
png_image_free in png.c in libpng 1.6.x before 1.6.37 has a use-after-freebecause png_image_free_function is called under png_safe_execute.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpng-tools - 1.6.36-5
libpng16-16 - 1.6.36-5
No subscription required

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

openjdk-8-demo - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
openjdk-8-jre - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
openjdk-8-source - 8u222-b10-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libpng1.6 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.36-5').
firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
openjdk-8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8u222-b10-1ubuntu2').
openjdk-lts package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '11.0.4+11-1ubuntu2').
